entry.title: Lattice QCD for Small Computers
entry.summary: These lectures discuss field theoretic techniques that might allow for realistic simulations of lattice QCD on small computers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 31 pages

entry.title: Dynamical Scaling from Multi-Scale Measurements
entry.summary: We present a new measure of the Dynamical Critical behavior: the "Multi-scale Dynamical Exponent (MDE)"
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages,Latex, Request figures from nathanp@vms.huji.ac.il

entry.title: Tricks to implement the overlap Dirac operator
entry.summary: I present several tricks to help implement the overlap Dirac operator numerically.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex, espcrc2.sty

entry.title: The Overlap Dirac Operator
entry.summary: This introductory presentation describes the Overlap Dirac Operator, why it could be useful in numerical QCD, and how it can be implemented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, Latex, cls file included

entry.title: Comment on "Percolation Properties of the 2D Heisenberg Model"
entry.summary: We comment on a recent paper by All\`es et al.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Monopoles Vortices and Confinement
entry.summary: The status of our understanding of colour confinement is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages.Presented at Rencontres de Moriond 2001.To appear in the proceedings

entry.title: Supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory on the lattice
entry.summary: Recent development in numerical simulations of supersymmetric Yang-Mills (SYM) theories on the lattice is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 37 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: $K\to ππ$ Decay Amplitude on the Lattice
entry.summary: Recent theoretical and numerical progresses of the lattice calculations of $K\to\pi\pi$ decay amplitude are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2002(plenary). 9 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Baryon Spectroscopy on the Lattice
entry.summary: Recent lattice QCD calculations of the baryon spectrum are outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary contribution to Baryons 2002, Jefferson Lab, March 2002, 9 pages, 7 figures

entry.title: Heavy Quark Physics and Lattice QCD
entry.summary: I review recent progress made on heavy quark physics on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk presented at Lattice2002(plenary),12 pages, 14 figures

entry.title: Some remarks on cyclization and periodicity
entry.summary: Conditions when application of cyclization procedure does not lead to the periodic function are specified. Sufficient conditions under which obtained function is periodic are stated.

entry.title: Exotics
entry.summary: We review lattice QCD results for glueballs (including a discussion of mixing with scalar mesons), hybrid mesons and other exotic states (such as $B_s B_s$ molecules).
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages, LATEX, 7 ps figures

entry.title: Lattice chiral fermions from continuum defects
entry.summary: We consider whether defects of co-dimension two could produce new lattice chiral fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, Latex

entry.summary: We comment on several issues concerning both the physics and authorship of article hep-lat/0305020.

entry.title: Status of International Lattice Data Grid -- An Overview --
entry.summary: We report on the status of the International Lattice Data Grid.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2004(ILDG),2 pages

entry.title: ILDG Middleware Working Group Status Report
entry.summary: We report on the status of the ILDG Middleware Working Group.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lat2004(ILDG)

entry.title: Physics at Tevatron Run II
entry.summary: We present recent physics results from the Tevatron Collider experiments CDF and D0. (contribution to Lattice 2004)
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 16 figures

entry.title: Gauge transformations in lattice chiral theories
entry.summary: We show that gauge-transformation properties of correlation functions in chiral gauge theories on the finite lattice are determined in a general way.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Comments on "Various Super Yang-Mills Theories with Exact Supersymmetry on the Lattice"
entry.summary: We make corrections on the paper by Sugino [{\it JHEP} {\bf 0501} (2005) 016].
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 figure

entry.title: On color confinement
entry.summary: The status of the theory of color confinemnt is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at IPM-LHP06, Tehran, Iran; PSN:IPM-LHP06-20May

entry.title: Twist two operators at finite volume
entry.summary: We calculate the volume corrections to the two-pion matrix element of twist two operators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure, references added

entry.title: Integrals over SU(N)
entry.summary: In this paper we calculate a number of integrals over SU(N) of interest in Hamiltonian Lattice Gauge Theory calculations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 Pages

entry.title: Fermionic Spectrum on General Dimensional Hyperdiamond Lattice
entry.summary: Withdrawn: replaced by e-Print: arXiv:0907.3774
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn: replaced by e-Print: arXiv:0907.3774

entry.title: Renormalization and lattice artifacts
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Summer School on "Modern perspectives in lattice QCD", Les Houches, August 3-28, 2009

entry.title: A 0-dimensional counter-example to rooting?
entry.summary: We provide an example of a 0-dimensional field theory where rooting does not work.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages; Physics Letters B (2010)

entry.title: Introduction to Non-perturbative Heavy Quark Effective Theory
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Summer School on "Modern perspectives in lattice QCD", Les Houches, August 3-28, 2009
entry.arxiv:comment: 71 pages

entry.title: Lattice QCD and Nuclear Physics
entry.summary: A short lecture given at the Summer School on "Modern perspectives in lattice QCD", Les Houches, August 3-28, 2009.
entry.arxiv:comment: 61 pages, 9 figures

entry.title: Lattice Dirac operators with chiral chemical potential
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Lattice results on charmonium
entry.summary: Recent lattice QCD results on charmonium spectroscopy are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 8 figures, to appear in the proceedings of The 5th International Workshop on Charm Physics (Charm 2012)

entry.title: Path Integrals and Voronin's Theorem on the Universality of the Riemann Zeta Function
entry.summary: We explore a new approach to the path integral for a latticized quantum theory. This talk is based on work with N. Khuri and H. Ren.

entry.title: A Proposal for Simulating Chiral Fermions
entry.summary: We describe a method for evaluating chiral gauge theories that is not plagued by the doubling problem. To demonstrate the efficiency of the approach, we apply our ideas to the chiral Schwinger model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, HLRZ 92-33

entry.title: Fermion induced SU$(N)$ Yang-Mills Theory
entry.summary: We investigate the gauge interaction induced by heavy fermions using both dimensional and lattice regularization. We study the condition under which heavy fermions induce a continuum gauge theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages; talk at Lattice '92, Amsterdam, requires , espcrc2.sty

entry.title: Anomalous Fermion Number Non-Conservation on the Lattice
entry.summary: The anomaly for the fermion number current is calculated on the lattice in a simple prototype model with an even number of fermion doublets.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, CERN-TH.6717/92. Contribution to the Amsterdam Lattice '92 Conference

entry.title: Noncompact Lattice Simulations of SU(2) Gauge Theory
entry.summary: Wilson loops have been measured at strong coupling, $\beta=0.5$, on a $12^4$ lattice in noncompact simulations of pure SU(2) without gauge fixing. There is no sign of quark confinement.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, UNM-93-nls

entry.title: Recent Developments in Lattice QCD
entry.summary: I review the current status of lattice QCD results. I concentrate on new analytical developments and on numerical results relevant to phenomenology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 35 pages, 4 figures (Figures are excerpted from others' work and are not included) Uses harvmac.tex

entry.title: O(a) Perturbative improvement for Wilson fermions
entry.summary: The coefficient of the O(a)-improved Sheikholeslami-Wohlert action for Wilson fermions are perturbatively determined at one-loop level and estimated at two-loop level.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8-pages + (two pages of Fig.s) MPI-ph/93-24

entry.title: Coloured Polymers
entry.summary: We show that non-oriented coloured polymers (self--avoiding walks with different types of links) are in the same universality class of the ordinary self--avoiding walks, while the oriented coloured are not.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pag., Latex, NBI-HE-93-06

entry.title: Lyapunov Spectra in SU(2) Lattice Gauge Theory
entry.summary: We develop a method for calculating the Lyapunov characteristic exponents of lattice gauge theories. The complete Lyapunov spectrum of SU(2) gauge theory is obtained and Kolmogorov-Sinai entropy is calculated. Rapid convergence with lattice size is found.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7pp, DUKE-TH-93-54

entry.title: Fitting Correlated Data
entry.summary: We discuss fitting correlated data - with the example of hadron mass spectroscopy in mind. The main conclusion is that the method of minimising correlated $\chi^2$ is unreliable if the data sample is too small.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, LATEX, 1 postscript figure enclosed, Liverpool LTH 321

entry.title: Running Coupling in SU(3) Yang-Mills Theory
entry.summary: We report about our ongoing computation of running coupling constants in asymptotically free theories using the recursive finite size scaling technique. The latest results for the SU(3) Yang-Mills theory are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, ps-file 81828 bytes

entry.title: QCD Spectroscopy
entry.summary: I review recent work on the calculation of hadron masses, decay constants and wave functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at Lattice 93, 18 pages of PostScript

entry.title: Reply to M.Campostrini's and P.Rossi's Comment on our paper `Nonuniformity of the $1/N$ Expansion for Two-Dimensional $O(N)$ Models'
entry.summary: This reply tries to rectify some misunderstandings that are in our opinion contained in the Comment by Campostrini and Rossi, <hep-lat 99407008> on our paper <hep-lat 9407003>.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Embedding the N=2 Supersymmetric Yang-Mills Theory in the Adjoint Higgs-Yukawa Model on the Lattice
entry.summary: The N=2 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory is formulated on the lattice. The feasibility of numerical simulations is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages with 1 figure, CERN-TH.7479/94

entry.title: Anisotropic Gauge Theories: A Numerical Study of the Fu-Nielsen Model
entry.summary: We study numerically 4+1 dimensional pure gauge theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of Lattice'94, held in Bielefeld, Germany

entry.title: Lattice sum rules for the colour fields
entry.summary: We analyse the sum rules describing the action and energy in the colour fields around glueballs, torelons and static potentials.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages LATEX, (typos corrected, to appear in Phys Rev D)

entry.title: Reply to David's Comment on ``Superinstantons and the Reliability of Perturbation Theory in Non-Abelian Models''
entry.summary: We reply to David's comment (hep-lat/9504017) on our paper Phys.Rev.Lett. 74(1995)1920.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, latex, no figures

entry.title: Electroweak Phase Transition and Numerical Simulations in the SU(2) Higgs Model
entry.summary: Recent progress in non-perturbative investigations of the electroweak phase transition is reviewed, with special emphasis on numerical simulations in the four-dimen\-sional SU(2) Higgs model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, latex, 2 figures. Lecture given at the $3^e$ Colloque Cosmologie, Paris, June 1995

entry.title: Lattice Chiral Fermions
entry.summary: I review the ongoing attempts to define chiral gauge theories using the lattice regularization.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at Lattice'95, Melbourne, Australia. LaTeX, 16 pages

entry.title: Hubbard Model with Luscher fermions - a progress report
entry.summary: Some modifications of the Luscher algorithm, which reduce the autocorelation time, are proposed and tested.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, uuencoded gzipped Postscript, contribution to Lattice 95

entry.title: Lattice Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: Sources of uncertainties in perturbative calculations, tadpole improvement and its role in lattice perturbation theory, and six recent calculations are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages of LATEX (uses espcrc2.sty) and 1 uuencoded ps figure. (Plenary talk at Lattice 95, Melbourne)

entry.title: Progress on lattice QCD algorithms
entry.summary: I review recent progress on algorithms for calculating quark propagators and for simulating full QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 uuencoded PostScript pages, contribution to LAT95 (fig.1 simplified to conserve space; available upon request)

entry.title: Lattice Quantum Gravity: Review and Recent Developments
entry.summary: We review the status of different approaches to lattice quantum gravity indicating the successes and problems of each. Recent developments within the dynamical triangulation formulation are then described. Plenary talk at LATTICE 95 July 11-15, Melbourne, Australia.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 8 figures

entry.title: Finite Temperature QCD on the Lattice
entry.summary: Recent progress in lattice QCD at finite temperature is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: uuencoded compressed PS file, 17 pages, 13 figures. Review talk given at the International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory {\it LATTICE 95}, Melbourne, Australia, 11-15 July, 1995

entry.title: QCD for Coarse Lattices
entry.summary: This is the Lattice '95 review of recent progress towards accurate QCD simulations using very coarse lattices. This development could have revolutionary implications for low energy (nonperturbative) QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages

entry.title: Perspectives in Lattice Gravity
entry.summary: We briefly overview the development of Euclidean quantum gravity in four dimensions regarded as a branch of statistical mechanics of discretized random manifolds.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages LaTex, style and misleading misprints corrected

entry.title: Improved Algorithm for Bosonized Fermion Determinant
entry.summary: Following the line of \cite{AS} we propose an improved algorithm which allows to calculate a D-dimensional fermion determinant integrating the exponent of D+1 dimensional Hermitean bosonic action. For a finite extra dimension the corrections decrease exponentially.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, latex

entry.title: Some Cautionary Remarks on Abelian Projection and Abelian Dominance
entry.summary: Some critical remarks are presented, concerning the abelian projection theory of quark confinement.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(topology) plenary session, uses psfig and espcrc2 packages

entry.title: Quarkonium Physics and $α_{strong}$ from Quarkonia
entry.summary: Recent results in Quarkonia are reviewed, including updates on spectroscopy and $\alpha_s$, and a first look at quarkonium annihilation decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(heavy quarks), 7 LaTeX pages plus 2 postscript figures, uses espcrc2.sty

entry.title: Precise Neutron Electric Form Factor from Lattice QCD
entry.summary: A new calculation of the neutron electric form factor is described. Preliminary results for the connected part on a $20^{3}\times 32$ lattice are presented. The methods for calculating the disconnected part are briefly described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Uuencoded gunzipped postscript file. Talk presented at DPF96

entry.title: Quenched Hadron Spectroscopy with Improved Actions
entry.summary: A variety of different combinations of improved gluon and fermion actions is tested for quenched hadron spectroscopy
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex, 4 figures, talk presented at the LATTICE96

entry.title: Comment on "The two-phase issue in the O(n) non-linear sigma-model: a Monte-Carlo study" by B.Alles, A.Buonanno and G.Cella
entry.summary: We comment on the recent paper by Alles et al (hep-lat/9608002)
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX2e, no figures

entry.title: Square Symanzik action to one-loop order
entry.summary: We present the one-loop coefficients for an alternative Symanzik improved lattice action with gauge groups SU(2) or SU(3).
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex, 1 table, no figures

entry.title: The Renormalization Group and Dynamical Triangulations
entry.summary: A block spin renormalization group approach is introduced which can be applied to dynamical triangulations in any dimension.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(gravity)

entry.title: Improved Quark Actions for Lattice QCD
entry.summary: I present a brief summary of the status and prospects of improved Wilson-type quark actions for coarse lattice simulations. My conclusions are optimistic.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX, uses sprocl.sty (included), talk at ``Multi-Scale Phenomena and Their Simulation'', Sept. 30 - Oct. 5, 1996, Bielefeld, Germany

entry.title: Brief Review of Multicanonical Simulations
entry.summary: Recent progress of simulations with non-canonical weight factors is summarized.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages latex and sprocl.sty. Published in the Proceedings of the International Conference on Multiscale Phenomena and Their Simulations (Bielefeld, October 1996), edited by F. Karsch, B. Monien and H. Satz (World Scientific, 1997)

entry.title: Properties of Renormalization Group Transformations
entry.summary: We describe some properties of Renormalization Group transformations. Especially we show why some of the RG transformations have redundant eigenoperators with eigenvalues that cannot be determined by simple dimensional analysis and give the corresponding formulae.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Perturbative Improvement for Lattice QCD: An Update
entry.summary: Recent developments in the Symanzik improvement program for lattice QCD are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the workshop on "Lattice QCD on Parallel Computers" (Tsukuba, March 1997). One file producing 12 pages; LaTeX

entry.title: Phase Transitions
entry.summary: This is a set of notes on phase transitions and critical phenomena prepared to accompany my lectures for the RHIC '97 summer school, held at Brookhaven from July 6 to 16, 1997.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages, 11 figures, 1 table. Lectures presented at RHIC '97

entry.title: Multiple mass solvers
entry.summary: We present a general method to construct multiple mass solvers from standard algorithms. As an example, the BiCGstab-M algorithm is derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Latex, espcrc2.sty, talk given at the Lattice '97, Edinburgh, July 22-26 1997

entry.title: Non-Perturbative Renormalisation and Kaon Physics
entry.summary: A general review is presented on the problem of non perturbative computation of the $K\to\pi\pi$ transition amplitude.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Latex, uses espcrc2.sty, Talk given at LATTICE97

entry.title: SUSY on the lattice
entry.summary: The motivation and perspectives of numerical simulations of supersymmetric Yang-Mills theories are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 6 pages, 4 figures; Talk presented at LATTICE97

entry.title: Real time simulations and the electroweak phase transition
entry.summary: We review recent developments in real-time simulations of SU(2)-Higgs theory near the electroweak transition and related topics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, latex, 4 figures; to appear in the proceedings of LATTICE '97

entry.title: Coarse lattice results for glueballs and hybrids
entry.summary: A review of new results from lattice simulations of glueballs and heavy-quark hybrid mesons is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures, uses espcrc2.sty. Contribution to Lattice '97, Edinburgh

entry.title: Physics from the lattice: glueballs in QCD; topology; SU(N) for all N
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Isaac Newton Institute, NATO-ASI School on "Confinement, Duality and Non-Perturbative Aspects of QCD", 23 June - 4 July, 1997.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX. Self-unpacking, tar-compressed file

entry.title: Lattice Models of Random Geometries
entry.summary: We review models of random geometries based on the dynamical lattice approach. We discuss one dimensional model of simplicial complexes (branched polymers), two dimensional model of dynamical triangulations and four dimensional model of simplicial gravity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 50 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: SYM on the lattice
entry.summary: Non-perturbative predictions and numerical simulations in supersymmetric Yang-Mills (SYM) theories are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 12 pages, 1 figure; Talk given at 31st International Symposium on the Theory of Elementary Particles Buckow, September 1997

entry.title: Monopole condensation and colour confinement
entry.summary: The evidence is reviewed for the mechanism of colour confinement in QCD by dual superconductivity of the ground state, i.e. by condensation of monopoles.
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages, Latex file + style + 10 PS figures

entry.title: Thermodynamics using Wilson and Staggered Quarks
entry.summary: Recent developements in QCD at finite temperature are reviewed. Particular emphasis is laid on results stemming from simulations which involve quarks.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages LATEX, 12 figures

entry.title: Spatial string tension in gluodynamics at finite temperature in a spherical model approximation
entry.summary: Spatial string tension is computed in finite temperature gluodynamics on asymmetric lattices in a spherical model approximation. Conditions of scaling behavior are specified. Discrepancies with a standard renormalisation procedure are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, revtex

entry.title: The theoretical background and properties of perfect actions
entry.summary: This lecture note starts with a pedagogical introduction to the theoretical background and properties of perfect actions, gives some details on topology and instanton solutions and ends with a discussion on the recent developments concerning chiral symmetry.
entry.arxiv:comment: 52 pages

entry.title: A Possible Lack of Phase Transition in SO(3) Lattice Gauge Theory on Lattices with Two Temporal Sites
entry.summary: This paper is being withdrawn as its main results are already included in section 2 of the paper hep-lat/9901006.

entry.title: Lattice study of Weak First Order Phase Transitions in D=4
entry.summary: The properties of several phase transitions relevant to the lattice study of Quantum Field Theory are investigated.
entry.arxiv:comment: PhD. thesis, 155 pages, LateX2e, 61 postscript figures included

entry.title: Exact Supersymmetry on the Lattice
entry.summary: We discuss the possibility of representing supersymmetry exactly in a lattice discretized system. In particular, we construct a perfect supersymmetric action for the Wess-Zumino model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTex, no figures

entry.title: Finite size analysis of the 3D gonihedric Ising model with k=0
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: The QCD Dirac Operator Spectrum and Finite-Volume Scaling
entry.summary: Random matrix theory and chiral Lagrangians offer a convenient tool for the exact calculation of microscopic spectral correlators of the Dirac operator in a well-defined finite-volume scaling regime.
entry.arxiv:comment: LATTICE98(confine)

entry.title: Ginsparg-Wilson relation and lattice Weyl fermions
entry.summary: We demonstrate that in the topologically trivial gauge sector the Ginsparg-Wilson relation for lattice Dirac operators admits an exactly gauge invariant path integral formulation of the Weyl fermions on a lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex, no figures

entry.title: Hamilton-Jacobi Equation and the Tree Formula for Proper Vertices
entry.summary: The tree formula, which relates proper and connected vertices, is shown to be the solution to a Hamilton-Jacobi equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages LaTeX2e (uses feynmf)

entry.title: Topical Results on Lattice Chiral Fermions in the CFA
entry.summary: We report new results on the lattice regularization of the chiral Schwinger model and the chiral U(1) model in four dimensions in the CFA.
entry.arxiv:comment: LATTICE98(chiral)

entry.title: Spectrum of the Hermitian Wilson Dirac operator
entry.summary: Recent results on the spectral properties of the Hermitian Wilson-Dirac operator are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 6 Postscript figures, LATTICE 98 (plenary)

entry.title: Hypercubic Random Surfaces with Extrinsic Curvature
entry.summary: We analyze a model of hypercubic random surfaces with an extrinsic curvature term in the action. We find a first order phase transition at finite coupling separating a branched polymer from a stable flat phase.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Multi-bosonic algorithms for dynamical fermion simulations
entry.summary: Multi-bosonic fermion simulation algorithms are reviewed, with particular emphasis on a recent application in SU(2) Yang-Mills theory with light gluinos.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 14 pages; talk given at the workshop "Molecular Dynamics on Parallel Computers", February 1999, NIC, J\"ulich

entry.title: The MultiBoson method
entry.summary: This review describes the multiboson algorithm for Monte Carlo simulations of lattice QCD, including its static and dynamical aspects, and presents a comparison with Hybrid Monte Carlo.
entry.arxiv:comment: to be published in Parallel Computing, 17 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Latest results from lattice QCD for exotic hybrid mesons
entry.summary: I review the results from lattice gauge theory for the masses of exotic hybrid mesons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Latex, no figures, Talk presented at Workshop on Hadron Spectroscopy, Laboratori Nazionali di Frascati - INFN, March 8-12 1999

entry.title: Vortex percolation and confinement
entry.summary: The vortex state which arises from a projection of SU(2) to $Z_2$ gauge theory is studied at finite temperatures with a special emphasis on the deconfinement phase transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 PS figures, LaTeX using PSFIG, talk presented at the workshop ''Understanding confinement'', ECT* Trento, March 1 - 13, 1999

entry.title: A test of a new simulation algorithm for dynamical quarks
entry.summary: Some results of test runs on a $6^3\times 12$ lattice with Wilson quarks and gauge group SU(2) for a previously proposed fermion algorithm by A. Slavnov are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Fermions on random lattices
entry.summary: We put fermions and define the Dirac operator and spin structures on a randomly triangulated 2d manifold.
entry.arxiv:comment: presented at LATTICE '99 (Pisa), latex 3pp. + 1 eps figure

entry.title: Confinement in QCD
entry.summary: The guiding lines of lattice investigations on colour confinement are reviewed, together with recent results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages,3 figures, Plenary talk at PANIC'99,10-16 June 1999,Uppsala

entry.title: Ginsparg-Wilson Games
entry.summary: I implement a set of tricks for constructing lattice fermion actions which approximately realize the Ginsparg-Wilson relation, with very promising results from simulations.
entry.arxiv:comment: LATTICE99(chiral fermions), 3 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Truncated Overlap Fermions
entry.summary: In this talk I propose a new computational scheme with overlap fermions and a fast algorithm to invert the corresponding Dirac operator.
entry.arxiv:comment: LATTICE99(algorithms)

entry.title: Glueballs and Hybrids (Gluons as Constituents)
entry.summary: After a brief introduction to hybrid and glueball source operators, I summarize recent lattice results for these particles.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, contribution to LATTICE-99, corrected glueball mass table

entry.title: On a possibility of adjoint colored states condensation at finite temperatures in lattice gauge model
entry.summary: Cooled down and diluted quark-gluon matter is considered. A possibility of condensation of multiquark clusters with zero N-alities is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice99:Finite Temperature and Density session

entry.title: $K -> ππ$ and $ε^\prime/ε$ using domain wall fermions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Gauge Theory and String Theory; An Introduction to the AdS/CFT Correspondence
entry.summary: Plenary talk at the conference, LATTICE 99, held in Pisa, Itay from June 29 to July 3, 1999.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of LATTICE 99; 5 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Better Domain-Wall Fermions
entry.summary: We discuss two modifications of domain-wall fermions, aimed to reduce the chiral-symmetry violations presently encountered in numerical simulations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, contribution to workshop "Lattice Fermions and Structure of the Vacuum" (Dubna, Russia), uses crckapb.sty

entry.title: Some Considerations on Lattice Gauge Fixing
entry.summary: Some problems related to Gribov copies in lattice gauge-fixing and their possible solution are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Latex, contribution to the workshop ``Lattice fermions and the structure of the vacuum'', 5-9 October, 1999, Dubna, Russia

entry.title: Some Considerations on Chiral Gauge Theories
entry.summary: Some general considerations on the problem of non-perturbative definition of Chiral Gauge Theories are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Latex, talk given at CHIRAL '99, Taipei, Sep. 13-18, 1999

entry.title: Remarks on Lattice Gauge Fixing
entry.summary: In this talk I briefly comment on the conventional lattice gauge fixing adopting a critical, even though constructive, numerical point of view.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 eps figures. Talk given at NATO workshop "Lattice Fermions and Structure of the Vacuum", DUBNA, Oct 1999

entry.title: Fast methods for computing the Neuberger Operator
entry.summary: I describe a Lanczos method to compute the Neuberger Operator and a multigrid algorithm for its inversion.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 2 figures. Talk given at the ``Interdisciplinary Workshop on Numerical Challenges to Lattice QCD'', Wuppertal, 22-24 August 1999

entry.title: Reply to A. Patrascioiu's and E. Seiler's Comment on our paper "Percolation properties of the 2D Heisenberg model"
entry.summary: Reply to comment appeared on hep-lat/9912014.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages

entry.title: Non-perturbative beta-function in SU(2) lattice gauge fields thermodynamics
entry.summary: The new method of nonperturbative calculation of the beta function in the lattice gauge theory is proposed. The method is based on the finite size scaling hypothesis.

entry.title: Hadron Structure in Lattice QCD: Exploring the Gluon Wave Functional
entry.summary: The use of lattice QCD to understand hadron structure is described, with particular emphasis on exploring the role of glue.

entry.title: Exact Chiral Symmetry with a non-perturbative cutoff
entry.summary: The main ideas behind the new ways to preserve chiral symmetries for lattice fermions are presented. The discussion is focused on vector-like fermions, the case relevant for lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX, includes sprocl.sty

entry.title: Regulated chiral gauge theories
entry.summary: Noncompact chiral abelian gauge theories are defined on the lattice using the overlap formalism. The main definitions are presented, the role of anomaly cancelation is discussed, and the triviality issue in four dimensions is explained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTeX, includes esfconf.sty

entry.title: Weak matrix elements and K-meson physics
entry.summary: An overview is presented about old and recent methods to compute the $K\to \pi \pi$ decay amplitude.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, talk presented at the XXXth International Conference on High Energy Physics (ICHEP 2000), July 27-August 2, 2000, Osaka, Japan

entry.title: Sinle-valued and spinor representations of orientation-preserved four-dimensional cubic group
entry.summary: We calculate the single-valued and spinor representations of $SO_4$, the orientation-preserved subgroup of $O_4$, on the base of our previous work on four-dimensional cubic group $O_4$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, Latex

entry.title: Magnetic condensation and confinement in lattice gauge theory
entry.summary: We investigate Abelian monopoles and Abelian vortices condensation in finite temperature SU(2) and SU(3) pure lattice gauge theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice 2000 (Topology and Vacuum), 4 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Recent results using the overlap Dirac operator
entry.summary: I derive the overlap Dirac operator starting from the overlap formalism, discuss the numerical hurdles in dealing with this operator and present ways to overcome them.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Talk given at DPF2000, Columbus, Ohio

entry.title: Problems in Lattice Gauge Fixing
entry.summary: We review many topics and results about numeric gauge fixing in lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 47 pages, 16 eps figures. Review article sent to IJMPA

entry.title: Fermion propagator at finite temperatures on extremely anisotropic lattice
entry.summary: Fermion propagator is computed in a simple model on an extremely anisotropic lattice $\xi\gg1$. Fermion determinant is evaluated up to $\xi^{-4}$ order. Chiral condensate is estimated in mean field approximation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages

entry.title: Majorana fermions on the lattice
entry.summary: The Monte Carlo simulation of Majorana fermions is discussed on the example of supersymmetric Yang-Mills (SYM) theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, latex using qmc.sty. Lecture given at the Workshop "Quantum Monte Carlo", ECT Trento, July 2001

entry.title: Atomic Bose Condensation and the Lattice
entry.summary: I show how interaction corrections to the Bose condensation temperature of an atomic gas can be computed using a combination of perturbative effective field theory and lattice techniques.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(spin)

entry.title: Theory of color confinement: state of the art
entry.summary: The existing evidence for dual superconductivity as mechanism of color confinement is reviewed. We also discuss what is known on the dual excitations, which produce confinement by condensation, and what are the open problems

entry.title: QCD spectroscopy with three light quarks
entry.summary: We report about a simulation using three dynamical Wilson quarks and on the progress in going to small quark masses.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(spectrum), 3 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Finite-volume meson propagators in quenched chiral perturbation theory
entry.summary: We compute meson propagators in finite-volume quenched chiral perturbation theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Lattice2001(chiral fermions)

entry.title: The Microscopic Dirac Operator Spectrum
entry.summary: We review the exact results for microscopic Dirac operator spectra based on either Random Matrix Theory, or, equivalently, chiral Lagrangians. Implications for lattice calculations are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(Plenary), 9 pages

entry.title: Generalized ensemble algorithm for U(1) gauge theory
entry.summary: Hybrid Monte Carlo simulations of the pure compact U(1) gauge theory are performed with the Tsallis weight. The simulations show that the use of the Tsallis weight enhances the tunneling rate between metastable states.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(algorithms), 3 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Ginsparg-Wilson fermions: practical aspects and applications
entry.summary: I review recent progress in the implementation of lattice fermions satisfying the Ginsparg-Wilson relation and some physical applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Talk at Lattice 2001(plenary)

entry.title: Light hadron spectrum and quark masses
entry.summary: Recent developments in lattice QCD calculations of the light hadron spectrum and quark masses are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 9 figures, Lattice2001(plenary), minor modifications in the text and table 1

entry.title: Topology and Low Lying Fermion Modes
entry.summary: Recent results concerning the relation of topology and low-lying fermion modes are summarized.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(plenary), 9 pages, 9 figures

entry.title: Confinement: Results and Perspectives
entry.summary: An updated review is presented of lattice investigations of colour confinement.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at "Statistical QCD", Bielefeld, August 26-30 2001. To appear in the Proceedings

entry.title: Z(3) Symmetric Dimensional Reduction of (2+1)D QCD
entry.summary: Here we present a candidate for a Z(3)-symmetric reduced action for the description of the (2+1)D SU(3) gauge theory
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, Statistical QCD proc

entry.title: Matrix Elements of Light Quarks
entry.summary: Lattice results for matrix elements of light quark operators are reviewed. The discussion is focused on recent theoretical progress and new numerical calculations which appeared after the Lattice 2000 Conference.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 8 figures

entry.title: Progress in lattice algorithms
entry.summary: The development of Monte Carlo algorithms for generating gauge field configurations with dynamical fermions and methods for extracting the most information from ensembles are summarised.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(plenary) 9 pages, 4 figures. Uses espcrc2.sty

entry.title: CP Violation and the CKM Matrix
entry.summary: This lecture provides a general overview of CP violation, emphasizing CP violation in flavour-violating interactions, such as due to the Kobayashi-Maskawa mechanism.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2001(plenary), 14 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Strings, quantum gravity and non-commutative geometry on the lattice
entry.summary: I review recent progress in understanding non-perturbative aspects of string theory, quantum gravity and non-commutative geometry using lattice methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice(plenary)

entry.title: Progress in understanding confinement
entry.summary: A few aspects of the mechanism of confinement of color by monopole condensation are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the conference HEPMAD 2001, Antananarivo 27 Sept 5 Oct 2001. To appear in the Proceedings

entry.title: Lattice Predictions for Hybrids and Glueballs
entry.summary: I review the results from lattice gauge theory for the properties of the light 1-+ exotic state and 0++ glueball.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at the European Workshop on the QCD Structure of the Nucleon held at Ferrara on April 3-6,2002

entry.title: The transfer matrix with Kogut-Susskind fermions
entry.summary: A transfer matrix for gauge theories on a lattice with Kogut-Susskind fermions in the flavour basis is constructed and some difficulties in the spin-diagonal basis are pointed out.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages

entry.title: Numerical results from large N reduced QCD_2
entry.summary: Some results in QCD_2 at large N are presented using the reduced model on the lattice. Overlap fermions are used to compute meson propagators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, contribution to Lattice 2002, Boston

entry.title: The Color-Flavor Transformation and Lattice QCD
entry.summary: We present the color-flavor transformation for gauge group SU(N_c) and discuss its application to lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, Lattice2002(theoretical), typo in Ref.[1] corrected

entry.title: Lanczos Methods for UV-Suppressed Fermions
entry.summary: In this talk I indroduce lattice fermions with suppressed cutoff modes. Then I present Lanczos based methods for stochastic evaluation of the fermion determinant.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 1 figure. Talk given at Lattice2002(algor)

entry.title: Large N reduction with overlap fermions
entry.summary: We revisit quenched reduction with fermions and explain how some old problems can be avoided using the overlap Dirac operator.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2002(chiral) 3 pages, no figures

entry.title: CP breaking in lattice chiral gauge theory
entry.summary: The CP symmetry is not manifestly implemented for the local and doubler-free Ginsparg-Wilson operator in lattice chiral gauge theory. We precisely identify where the effects of this CP breaking appear.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Lattice2002(chiral)

entry.title: Light quark masses from UKQCD's dynamical simulations with O(a)-improved Wilson fermions
entry.summary: I present preliminary results on the light quark masses from a partially quenched analysis of UKQCD's dynamical datasets.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2002(spectrum), 3 pages, 3 figures, Edinburgh preprint 2002/13

entry.title: Alternative Numerical Techniques
entry.summary: Two new approaches to numerical QFT are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2002(theoretical), 3 pages

entry.title: Effective Potential for Polyakov Loops in Lattice QCD
entry.summary: Toward the derivation of an effective theory for Polyakov loops in lattice QCD, we examine Polyakov loop correlation functions using the multi-level algorithm which was recently developed by Luscher and Weisz.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2002(nonzerot),3 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: An introduction to lattice QCD at non--zero temperature and density
entry.summary: This is an informal overview of methods and results on the QCD phase diagram and lattice termodynamics aimed at specialists in nearby fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages; lecture at the GISELDA Meeting held in Frascati, Italy, 14-18 January 2002

entry.title: Dimensional reduction of Lattice Gauge Theory in (2+1)D
entry.summary: This is my Ph.D. thesis defended earlier this year. It contains mostly information already presented in previous Bielefeld/Saclay papers on this subject, though in more detailed form. It also includes actual calculations and some unpublished material on phase structure of the reduced model.
entry.arxiv:comment: ph.d. thesis

entry.title: Some peculiarities of transition from discrete to continuum Fourier series in lattice theories
entry.summary: Transition from discrete to continuous Fourier series is studied for the functions becoming singular in the transition. Conditions are specified when summing replacement by integration is inadmissible.

entry.title: Global Monte Carlo for fermions using ordered statistics
entry.summary: In this talk I discuss a new possibility for stochastic representation of the fe rmion determinant. The method can be used for global Monte Carlo fermion algorit hms and is tested in the case of the Schwinger model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Lattice2003 (Machines I)

entry.title: Recent Developments in Lattice Supersymmetry
entry.summary: I discuss a new approach to constructing lattices for gauge theories with extended supersymmetry. The lattice theories themselves respect certain supersymmetries, which in many cases allows the target theory to be obtained in the continuum limit without fine-tuning.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2003(plenary)

entry.title: Lattice Extraction of $ε^\prime/ε$ using (PQ) Chiral Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: Results at NLO in (PQ)ChPT for extracting $\epsilon^\prime/\epsilon$ from lattice data are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Lattice 2003(matrix) conference proceedings

entry.title: Dimensional reduction and a Z(3) symmetric model
entry.summary: We present first results from a numerical investigation of a Z(3) symmetric model based on dimensional reduction.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at XXI International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory lattice2003(Non-zero temperature and density)

entry.title: Confinement of Color: A Review
entry.summary: The status of our understanding of the mechanisms of color confinement is reviewed, in particular the results of numerical simulations on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at XII International Conference on Selected Problems of Modern Physics, Dubna, June 2003, to appear in the proceedings. 10 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Higher-order perturbation theory for highly-improved actions
entry.summary: I review techniques and applications of higher-order perturbation theory for highly-improved lattice actions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Some added references, clarification of Figs. 4 and 5, and some minor textual changes

entry.title: Dynamical Domain Wall Fermions
entry.summary: We report on an exploratory study of N_f=2 dynamical domain wall fermions and the DBW2 gauge action at weak coupling. Details of improved simulation algorithms and preliminary results for the hadron spectrum and renormalised light and strange quark masses will be presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2003(spectrum), 3 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Quarkonium at finite temperature
entry.summary: I discuss quarkonium spectral functions at finite temperature reconstructed using the Maximum Entropy Method. I show in particular that the J/psi survives in the deconfined phase up to 1.5Tc
entry.arxiv:comment: Poster contribution to Confinement 2003, July 21-24, RIKEN, Japan, LaTeX, 1 page, 1 figure, uses ws-procs9x6.cls

entry.title: Non-Perturbative Renormalization and the Fermilab Action
entry.summary: We discuss the application of the regularization independent (RI) scheme of Rome/Southampton to determine the normalization of heavy quark operators non-perturbatively using the Fermilab action.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2003(improve), 3 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Application of DWF to heavy-light mesons
entry.summary: We consider application of domain wall fermions to quarks with relatively heavy masses, aiming at precision calculations of charmed meson properties. Preliminary results for a few basic quantities are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Lattice2003(heavy), 3 pages, 3 figures

entry.title: Actions for dynamical fermion simulations: are we ready to go?
entry.summary: A critical review, playing devil's advocate, on present dynamical fermion simulations is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to Lattice2003 (plenary talk), Latex, 14 pages, 11 figures

entry.title: An Introduction to Lattice Chiral Fermions
entry.summary: This write-up starts by introducing lattice chirality to people possessing a fairly modern mathematical background, but little prior knowledge about modern physics. I then proceed to present two new and speculative ideas.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, contribution to "Third International Workshop on QCD and Numerical Analysis"

entry.title: An estimate of the flavour singlet contributions to the hyperfine splitting in charmonium
entry.summary: We explore the splitting between flavour singlet and non-singlet mesons in charmonium. This has implications for the hyperfine splitting in charmonium.

entry.title: From the Abelian projected flux tube to the dual Abelian Higgs model
entry.summary: A recent detailed study of the Q-anti-Q flux tube and its DAHM analysis is reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to Confinement 2003, July 21-24, RIKEN, Japan, 1 page

entry.title: Remnant Symmetry and the Confinement Phase in Coulomb Gauge
entry.summary: We report on connections between the confining color Coulomb potential, center vortices, and the unbroken realization of remnant gauge symmetry in Coulomb gauge.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. Invited talk at "QCD Down Under," Adelaide, Australia, March 2004

entry.title: Pion scattering on the lattice with chirally improved fermions
entry.summary: We report preliminary results for the I=2 pion scattering length a_0, calculated with chirally improved fermions. After chiral extrapolation our results are in good agreement with both, experimental and theoretical predictions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Poster presented at Lattice2004(spectrum)

entry.title: Chiral perturbation theory at non-zero lattice spacing
entry.summary: A review of chiral perturbation theory for lattice QCD at non-zero lattice spacing is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 2 figures. Talk presented at Lattice2004(plenary), Fermilab, June 21-26, 2004. Version 2: Typos corrected

entry.title: QCD Thermodynamics on lattice
entry.summary: I discuss recent developments in lattice QCD thermodynamics on the nature of the transition at finite temperature and density, equation of state, screening of static charges and meson spectral functions at high temperatures.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given on Lattice 2004 (plenary) Fermilab, June 21-26, 2004

entry.title: Pentaquarks: Status and Perspectives for Lattice Calculations
entry.summary: The present status of pentaquark spectroscopy in lattice QCD is reviewed. This talk also includes a brief introduction of pentaquark baryons.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at Lattice2004(plenary), Fermilab, June 21-26, 2004, 7 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Hadron Spectrum from Dynamical Lattice QCD Simulations
entry.summary: Recent progress in unquenched lattice QCD simulations is reviewed with emphasis on understanding of chiral behavior for light quark masses.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 12 figures, Lattice 2004 (plenary) Fermilab, June 21-26, 2004

entry.title: Asymptotic series for distributions
entry.summary: Asymptotic expansions for a wide class of distribution are studied. A simple method for computation of the series coefficients is suggested. The case when regularization parameter of the distribution depends on the asymptotic parameter is considered.

entry.title: Physics issues in simulations with dynamical overlap fermions
entry.summary: We discuss the impact of various improvements on simulations of dynamical overlap fermions using the Hybrid Monte Carlo algorithm. We focus on the usage of fat links and multiple pseudo-fermion fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 10 figures

entry.title: Quarkonium correlators and spectral functions at zero and finite temperature from Fermilab action
entry.summary: We study charmonium and bottomonium systems at zero and finite temperatures using Lattice QCD with Fermilab action on anisotropic lattices.
entry.arxiv:comment: contribution to Hard Probes 2004

entry.title: CP and T violation in non-perturbative chiral gauge theories
entry.summary: We give a completely general derivation revealing the precise origin and the quantitative effects of CP and T violations in chiral gauge theories on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Monte Carlo Hamiltonian of lattice gauge theory
entry.summary: We discuss how the concept of the Monte Carlo Hamiltonian can be applied to lattice gauge theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: "Non-Perturbative Quantum Field Theory: Lattice and Beyond", Guangzhou, China 2004

entry.title: Critical Behaviour in Statistical QCD
entry.summary: We survey the critical behaviour of strongly interacting matter, as determined in finite temperature lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 8 figures: plenary talk at "QCD and Hadronic Physics", Beijing 2005

entry.title: Tuning anisotropies for dynamical gauge configurations
entry.summary: We present methods and results for the tuning of quark and gluon anisotropies for improved actions in N_f = 2 QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 8 figures. Conference proceedings from talk by R. Morrin at Lattice 2005 Dublin

entry.title: Confinement in QCD: Results and Open Problems
entry.summary: Progress is reviewed in the understanding of color confinement .
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages, 17 figures.Presented at The Cracow School of Theoretical Physics, XLV Course,Zakopane june 2005. To appear in Acta Physica Polonica

entry.title: Simulations in Early Universe Theory
entry.summary: We give an impression of the type of results that have been obtained with numerical lattice simulations of field theory in the early universe.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, contribution to Lattice 2005

entry.title: Effective Lattice Actions for Finite-Temperature Yang-Mills Theory
entry.summary: We determine effective lattice actions for the Polyakov loop using inverse Monte Carlo techniques.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 4 figures, talk presented by TH at Extreme QCD, Swansea, 2-5 Aug 2005

entry.title: Random membrane model for lattice gluodynamics
entry.summary: odel for studying coupling dependence on lattice spacing a in gluodynamics is suggested. The model predicts $g-> g_{0}>0 with a->0. Free energy density in the model does not depend on temperature.

entry.title: A Quasi-staggered Scheme on Lattice
entry.summary: Utilizing a picture of string and string spinors, we show a simpler version of staggered action. The advantage of this action is that in this action there always exist pair of quarks with different masses.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Peculiar Properties of SU(2) Gauge Field Thermodynamics on a Finite Lattice. Calculation of Beta-function
entry.summary: The new method of nonperturbative calculation of the beta-function in the lattice gauge theory is proposed. The method is based on the finite size scaling hypothesis.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: The critical end point in QCD
entry.summary: In this talk I present the logic behind, and examine the reliability of, estimates of the critical end point (CEP) of QCD using the Taylor expansion method.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at SEWM 06 by SG

entry.title: Lattice QCD at finite temperature
entry.summary: I discuss recent developments in finite temperature lattice QCD, including the calculation of the transition temperature, equation of state, color screening and meson spectral functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at Strong and Electroweak Matter 2006, May 2006, 8 pages, 8 figures, uses espcrc1.sty

entry.title: Algorithms for dynamical overlap fermions
entry.summary: An overview of the current status of algorithmic approaches to dynamical overlap fermions is given. In particular the issue of changing the topological sector is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 4 figures, plenary talk delivered at Lattice 2006

entry.title: Confinement from Gauge Invariance in 2+1 Dimensions
entry.summary: It is shown, in D=2+1 dimensions, that by merely imposing non-abelian gauge invariance on the temporal gauge ground state wavefunctional of an abelian gauge theory, a confining state is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: Analytic Estimate of the Order Parameter for Monopole Condensation in QCD
entry.summary: The disorder parameter $<\mu>$ for the condensation of monopoles in QCD is estimated analytically in terms of gauge invariant field strength correlators. The continuum limit is discussed.

entry.title: SU(3)-breaking effects in hyperon semileptonic decays
entry.summary: We present the first quenched lattice QCD study of all the vector and axial form factors relevant for the hyperon semileptonic decay Sigma- -> n l nu.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk delivered to the 5th International Workshop on Chiral Dynamics, Durham/Chapel Hill, NC, USA, Sept. 18-22, 2006

entry.title: Lattice QCD simulations with light dynamical quarks
entry.summary: I report recent results from full QCD simulations by CP-PACS and JLQCD collaborations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 7 figures. Plenary talk given at "Quark Confinement and the Hadron Spectrum VII", Azores, Portugal, 2-7 September 2006

entry.title: The author replies
entry.summary: I respond to the Bernard et al. comment on my letter ``Chiral anomalies and rooted staggered fermions.''
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages. Rebuttal to arXiv:hep-lat/0603027. To appear in Physics Letters B

entry.title: Minimal Walking on the Lattice
entry.summary: We provide the first evidence of a walking dynamics for two color lattice Yang-Mills theory with two Dirac flavors in the symmetric representation of the gauge group.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 12 figures

entry.title: Monte Carlo Methods in Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: In these lecture notes some applications of Monte Carlo integration methods in Quantum Field Theory - in particular in Quantum Chromodynamics - are introduced and discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 34 pages, 5 figures; Lectures given at Spring School on High Energy Physics, Jaca, Spain, May 6-18, 2007

entry.title: Disorder parameter for confinement and vacuum field strength correlators
entry.summary: The possibility is explored to relate confinement to properties of gauge invariant field strength correlators.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. Talk presented at The XXV International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory, July 30-4 August 2007, Regensburg - Germany

entry.title: Recent progress on color confinement
entry.summary: The status is reviewed of the dual superconductivity of QCD vacuum as a mechanism of color confinement.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. Invited talk at the conference QCD@Work 2007, Martina Franca (Italy) June 16-20 2007

entry.title: Confinement and dual superconductivity of QCD vacuum
entry.summary: The mechanism of dual superconductivity for confinement is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. Talk presented at the Nineth Workshop on Non perturbative QCD, Paris 4-6 June 2007

entry.title: Excited hadrons on the lattice - State of the art and future challenges
entry.summary: We review the techniques of lattice QCD calculations for excited hadrons with light quarks and outline the future challenges that are faced in calculations with fully dynamical fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited plenary talk at NSTAR07

entry.title: Topological susceptibility in two-flavor QCD
entry.summary: We compute the topological susceptibility in QCD with two flavors of dynamical fermions using numerical simulation with overlap fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages,7 figures

entry.title: Solution of symmetry equation and hierarchy of self dual Yang-Mills systems
entry.summary: The solution of symmetry equation of Yang-Mills self dual system is found in explicit form of its raising Hamiltonian operator. Thus explicit form of equations of self dual Yang Mills hierarchy is constructed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages,no figures

entry.title: Lattice status of gluonia/glueballs
entry.summary: I briefly review lattice QCD calculations that study the 0++ glueball and discuss implications for light flavour singlet 0++ mesons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages. Write up for the talk presented at 14th High-Energy Physics International Conference in Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD 08), Montpellier, France, 7-12 Jul 2008

entry.title: Twisted mass QCD and the FNAL heavy quark formalism
entry.summary: At tree level, I discuss modifying the FNAL heavy quark formalism to include a twisted mass term. I find that at maximal twist the so called KLM factor is independent of the heavy mass.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, no figures

entry.title: Large N
entry.summary: I review some of the things we have learned about large N gauge theories (and QCD at N=oo) from lattice calculations in recent years. I point to some open problems.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at Lattice 2008

entry.title: Hyperon Physics from Lattice QCD
entry.summary: I review recent lattice calculations of hyperon physics, including hyperon spectroscopy, axial coupling constants, form factors and semileptonic decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited plenary talk at the 8th International Conference on Hyperons, Charm and Beauty Hadrons

entry.title: Current Status toward the Proton Mass Calculation in Lattice QCD
entry.summary: The proton mass calculation is still a tough challenge for lattice QCD. We discuss the current status and difficulties based on the recent PACS-CS results for the hadron spectrum in 2+1 flavor QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings for the Moriond 2009 QCD session, 4 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: The partition function of gauge supersymmetric Ising model on 3D regular lattice
entry.summary: The partition function (quantum transition amplitude) of the gauge system with gauge group $Z_2$ coupled with Majorana fermions is calculated on the regular 3D cubic lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 35 pages, 7 figures

entry.title: Lattice QCD
entry.summary: Some topics from recent progresses in lattice QCD are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 6 figures, A plenary talk given at The International Conference on Particle And Nuclei (PANIC08), Eilat, Israel, November 9-14, 2008

entry.title: Layer World: Living on a layer in 5D SU(3)
entry.summary: We suggest another approach to five-dimensional non-isotropic gauge theory. Using non-perturbative technique we show that already modest interaction anisotropy confines heavy bound states to four-dimensional layers, while free quarks propagate with almost no penalty into the fifth dimension.

entry.title: Numerical test of the Gribov-Zwanziger scenario in Landau gauge
entry.summary: We review the status of lattice simulations of gluon and ghost propagators in Landau gauge, testing predictions of the Gribov-Zwanziger confinement scenario.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 4 postscript figures, talk presented at QCD-TNT09

entry.title: Light Baryons from 2+1 flavor DWF QCD
entry.summary: We present results from the RBC and UKQCD collaboration ensembles of 2+1 flavor DWF QCD for the light baryon spectrum.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages 5 figures

entry.title: Computational Strategies in Lattice QCD
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Summer School on "Modern perspectives in lattice QCD", Les Houches, August 3-28, 2009
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex source, 72 pages, 23 figures; v2: misprints corrected, minor text changes

entry.title: Lattice QCD at non-zero temperature and baryon density
entry.summary: Lectures given at the Summer School on "Modern perspectives in lattice QCD", Les Houches, August 3-28, 2009
entry.arxiv:comment: 63 pages, typos corrected

entry.title: Charmonium Spectroscopy from Lattice QCD
entry.summary: I give a short review of the current status of lattice QCD calculations of the spectrum of charmonium.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pp., 10 figs., to appear in the Proceedings of the Beijing CHARM2010 conference, October 21-24, 2010 (World Scientific)

entry.title: Index and overlap construction for staggered fermions
entry.summary: Recent developments regarding index and overlap construction for staggered fermions are reviewed, highlighting the surprising and unexpected aspects.
entry.arxiv:comment: proceedings contribution for 28th International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory, Lattice2010, June 14-19, 2010, Villasimius, Italy (slightly extended version, 8 pages)

entry.title: Electric and Magnetic Screening Masses around the Deconfinement Transition
entry.summary: We report on the status of our study of gluon propagators and screening masses around the de- confining transition for pure SU(2) gauge theory in Landau gauge.
entry.arxiv:comment: presented at Lattice 2011; 7 pages, 6 postscript figures

entry.title: Numerical study of hot strongly interacting matter
entry.summary: I review recent progress in study of strongly interacting matter at high temperatures using Monte-Carlo simulations in lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at Conference on Computational Physics, Oct. 30 - Nov. 3, 2011, Gatlinburg TN, LaTeX uses jpconf11.clo, jpconf.cls

entry.title: Log-normal distribution for correlators in lattice QCD?
entry.summary: Many hadronic correlators used in spectroscopy calculations in lattice QCD simulations appear to show a log-normal distribution at intermediate time separations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 13 figures

entry.title: Kaon semi-leptonic form factor in lattice QCD
entry.summary: This talk reviews recent lattice QCD simulations of the K->pi semi-leptonic form factor.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of CKM 2012, the 7th International Workshop on the CKM Unitarity Triangle, University of Cincinnati, USA, 28 September - 2 October 2012

entry.title: Strong coupling and quark masses from lattice QCD
entry.summary: I review lattice QCD calculations of the strong coupling and quark masses.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at the International Workshop on Determination of the Fundamental Parameters of QCD. The paper is an extended version of the 10 pages submitted to be published in Mod. Phys. Lett. A

entry.title: $q\bar q$-potential: a critical reappraisal
entry.summary: We show how it is possible to define and compute the potential between $q$ and $\bar q$ external sources in the singlet and octet (adjoint) representation of the colour group.

entry.title: Understanding Color Confinement
entry.summary: Some aspects are discussed of the mechanism of color confinement in QCD by condensation of magnetic monopoles in the vacuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at the Conference Windows on the Universe, Quy Nhon (Vietnam) Aug. 11-17 2013

entry.title: QCD at non-zero temperature and magnetic field
entry.summary: A status of lattice QCD thermodynamics, as of 2013, is summarized. Only bulk thermodynamics is considered. There is a separate section on magnetic fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk, 31st International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory, July 29 - August 3, 2013, Mainz, Germany; LaTeX source, 20 pages, 16 figures

entry.title: LQCD: Flavor Physics and Spectroscopy
entry.summary: I review highlights of recent results in quark-flavor physics and heavy-quark spectroscopy from lattice QCD, with emphasis on $B$-meson decays and excited and exotic charmonium states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pp, 25 figs, Lepton Photon 2015

entry.title: Lattice QCD: bulk and transport properties of QCD matter
entry.summary: We present an overview of the most recent results on bulk and transport properties of QCD matter inferred from lattice QCD simulations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 7 figures, Proceedings of the Quark Matter 2015 conference, Kobe, Japan

entry.title: Confinement from Center Vortices: A review of old and new results
entry.summary: I briefly review the numerical evidence, some old and some quite recent, in favor of the center vortex theory of confinement.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the Confinement 12 meeting, Thessaloniki, Greece, Aug. 2016. 12 pages, 8 figures

entry.title: Center Vortices and Topological Charge
entry.summary: I review important aspects of the relation between center vortices and topological charge, leading to chiral symmetry breaking.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited Talk at ExcitedQCD 2017 in Sintra, Portugal

entry.title: Fermion zero mode associated with instantonlike self-dual solution to lattice Euclidean gravity
entry.summary: We prove the existence of lattice fermion zero mode associated with self-dual lattice gravity solution.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages

entry.title: Vectorized Cluster Search
entry.summary: Contrary to conventional wisdom, the construction of clusters on a lattice can easily be vectorized, namely over each ``generation'' in a breadth first search. This applies directly to, e.g., the {\it single cluster} variant of the Swendsen-Wang algorithm. On a Cray Y-MP, total CPU time was reduced by a factor 3.5 -- 7 in actual applications.

entry.title: Microcanonical cluster algorithms
entry.summary: I propose a numerical simulation algorithm for statistical systems which combines a microcanonical transfer of energy with global changes in clusters of spins. The advantages of the cluster approach near a critical point augment the speed increases associated with multi-spin coding in the microcanonical approach. The method also provides a limited ability to tune the average cluster size.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages

entry.title: Scalar and axial matrix elements of the nucleon: sea quark content
entry.summary: Sea quark contributions to the scalar density and the axial current matrix elements of the nucleon are studied in lattice qcd with two flavours of dynamical wilson fermions. the results are compared to trends in heavy quark mass expansions, and contrasted with the numbers obtained using dynamical staggered fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, to appear in lat91 proceedings

entry.title: Non--perturbative bounds on the Higgs mass in the minimal standard model
entry.summary: This is a slightly extended version of the talk delivered at the Topical Workshop ``Non perturbative aspects of chiral gauge theories'', Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei, Roma, 9-11 March, 1992. Abstract: The Higgs mass in the minimal standard model is bounded by triviality and vacuum stability in the range 50--100 $GeV$ to 700--900 $GeV$. Recent results will be presented in brief and directions for future work will be proposed.

entry.title: Dynamics of Langevin Simulation
entry.summary: This chapter [of a supplement to Prog. Theo. Phys.] reviews numerical simulations of quantum field theories based on stochastic quantization and the Langevin equation. The topics discussed include renormalization of finite step-size algorithms, Fourier acceleration, and the relation of the Langevin equation to hybrid stochastic algorithms and hybrid Monte Carlo.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pp

entry.title: The Running Coupling from Lattice Gauge Theory
entry.summary: From an accurate determination of the inter-quark potential, one can study the running coupling constant for a range of $R$-values and hence estimate the scale $\Lambda_{\msbar} $. Detailed results are presented for $SU(2)$ pure gauge theory to illustrate the method.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages Liverpool preprint LTH279, 24 Jan 1992 (1 figure not enclosed) (Accepted for publication in Phys Lett B )

entry.title: Reflection positive formulation of chiral gauge theories on a lattice
entry.summary: Gauge invariant chiral theories satisfying the reflection positivity is constructed on a lattice. This requires the introduction of "half gauge fields" defined some time ago by Brydges, Fr\"{o}hlich, and Seiler \cite{BFS}. A two-dimensional model is considered in some detail.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages

entry.title: Mirror fermions in chiral gauge theories
entry.summary: Mirror fermions appear naturally in lattice formulations of the standard model. The phenomenological limits on their existence and discovery limits at future colliders are discussed. After an introduction of lattice actions for chiral Yukawa-models, a recent numerical simulation is presented. In particular, the emerging phase structure and features of the allowed region in renormalized couplings are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages

entry.title: Finite size effects and scaling in lattice CP(N-1)
entry.summary: We present model predictions for the spectrum of $CP^{N-1}$ in a periodic box and use them to interpret the strong finite size effects observed in lattice simulations at medium values of $N$. The asymptotic scaling behaviour of alternative lattice actions is discussed along with some aspects of multigrid algorithm efficiency.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages of text plus 2 pages of figures, Liverpool Preprint LTH283

entry.title: Gauge Fixing on the Lattice without Ambiguity
entry.summary: A new gauge fixing condition is discussed, which is (lattice) rotation invariant, has the `smoothness' properties of the Landau gauge but can be efficiently computed and is unambiguous for almost all lattice gauge field configurations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, no figs, HLRZ-92-25/BUTP-92-19

entry.title: A Method for Simulating Chiral Fermions on the Lattice
entry.summary: A method for simulating chiral gauge theories on the lattice is proposed, involving zeromodes on a topological defect. Lattice doublers may be decoupled in a gauge invariant manner, and flavor anomalies can be directly observed on a finite lattice. (Requires harvmac)
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, UCSD-PTH-92-16

entry.title: Numerical study of Yang-Mills classical solutions on the twisted torus
entry.summary: We use the lattice cooling method to investigate the structure of some gauge fixed SU(2) Yang-Mills classical solutions of the euclidean equations of motion which are defined in the 3-torus with symmetric twisted boundary conditions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20pp (fig.included)

entry.title: Fermions in Models with Wilson--Yukawa Couplings
entry.summary: Our work on models with Wilson--Yukawa couplings is reviewed. Conclusions include the failure of such models to produce continuum chiral gauge theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 1 figure, Wash. U. HEP/92-81

entry.title: 1/N Expansion and Particle Spectrum in Induced QCD
entry.summary: We study the 1/N expansion in the recently proposed model of the lattice gauge theory induced by heavy scalar field in adjoint representation. In the first approximation the fluctuations of the density of eigenvalues of the scalar field are Gaussian, so that the scalar glueball spectrum is defined from the corresponding linear wave equation.

entry.title: The equivalence of the SU(N) Yang Mills Theory with a Purely Fermionic Model
entry.summary: We investigate the detailed conditions under which a purely fermionic model with current-current interaction goes over to a renormalizable, asymptotically free SU$(N)$ gauge theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, eqs.(6) and (17) are appended as postscipt files at the end

entry.title: Crossover Between Weakly and Strongly Self-avoiding Random Surfaces
entry.summary: We investigate the crossover between weak and strong self-avoidance in a simulation of random surfaces with extrinsic curvature. We consider both dynamically triangulated and rigid surfaces with the two possible discretizations of the extrinsic curvature term.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages

entry.title: Embedding Z(3) in SU(3)
entry.summary: We consider the design of a non-local MonteCarlo algorithm for $SU(3)$ lattice systems according to the idea of {\em embedding} the degrees of freedom corresponding to the center of the group $Z(3)$. As a crucial ingredient to reach this goal, we present a practical implementation of a cluster algorithm for $Z(3)$ systems with general random pair interaction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages

entry.title: Lattice Calculation of QCD Vacuum Correlation Functions
entry.summary: The first exploratory calculations of QCD vacuum correlation functions on a lattice are reported. Qualitative agreement with phenomenological results is obtained in channels for which experimental data are available, and these correlation functions are shown to be useful in exploring approximations based on sum rules and interacting instantons.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 3 figures MIT-CTP # 2113

entry.title: Critical Momenta of Lattice Chiral Fermions
entry.summary: We determine the critical momenta for chiral fermions in the domain wall model recently suggested by Kaplan. For a wide range of domain wall masses $m$ and Wilson couplings $r$ we explicitly exhibit the regions in momentum space where the fermions are chiral. We compare the critical momenta for the infinitely large system with those obtained on a finite lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: UCSD/PTH 92-29

entry.title: Glueballs and Hybrid Mesons
entry.summary: We discuss states in the meson spectrum which have explicit gluonic components. Glueballs (with no valence quarks) and hybrid mesons (with valence quarks) are both reviewed. We present in some detail lattice simulation results. ( to appear in proceedings of QCD-20 years, Aachen Workshop)
entry.arxiv:comment: 15pp., (2 figs not enclosed), LTH 286

entry.title: Chern-Simons term and Topological Charge on the Lattice
entry.summary: In a somewhat overlooked work by Seiberg, a definition of the topological charge for SU(N) lattice fields was given. Here, it is shown that Seibergs and L\"{u}schers charge definition are related up to the section of the bundle. With the continued interest in baryon number violating processes, Seibergs paper is useful since it allows for a Chern-Simons number also.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages plus one PS figure, HLRZ-92-61

entry.title: Lyapunov Exponent of SU(3) Gauge Theory
entry.summary: The classical SU(3) gauge theory is shown to be deterministic chaotic. Its largest Lyapunov exponent is dertermined, from which a short time scale of thermalization of a pure gluon system is estimated. The connection to gluon damping rate is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9pages, 5 figures appended as PostScript files, DUKE-TH-92-41

entry.title: Basis States for Hamiltonian QCD with Dynamical Quarks
entry.summary: We discuss the construction of basis states for Hamiltonian QCD on the lattice, in particular states with dynamical quark pairs. We calculate the matrix elements of the operators in the QCD Hamiltonian between these states. Along with the ``harmonic oscillator'' states introduced in previous pure SU(3) work, these states form a working basis for calculations in full QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, LaTeX, BUHEP-92-33

entry.title: Wave functions and their use in spectroscopy and phenomenology
entry.summary: We describe the calculation of Coulomb gauge wave functions for light quark systems, and their use as interpolating fields for excited state spectroscopy.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages latex with lat92 macro plus 4 postscript figs, COLO-HEP-292

entry.title: On reflection positive formulation of chiral gauge theories on a lattice
entry.summary: A formulation of chiral gauge theories on a lattice which is both reflection positive and gauge invariant is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, no figures, INR-785/92, to be published in the proceedings of Lattice '92, Nucl. Phys. B (Proc. Suppl.)

entry.title: Three-Loop Results on the Lattice
entry.summary: We present some new three-loop results in lattice gauge theories, for the Free Energy and for the Topological Susceptibility. These results are an outcome of a scheme which we are developing (using a symbolic manipulation language), for the analytic computation of renormalization functions on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: (Contribution to Lattice-92 conference). 4 pages

entry.title: The Quenched Approximation in Health and in Sickness
entry.summary: We present results for physical quantities computed in quenched chiral perturbation theory and compare them with the corresponding unquenched expressions. We also point out an apparent theoretical problem of the quenched approximation. latex, file espcrc2.sty needed (appended at the end: search for espcrc2.sty).
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages (sorry, latex error in first version)

entry.title: Gribov Copies and Other Gauge Fixing Beasties on the Lattice
entry.summary: Write-up for Lattice'92, held in Amsterdam. preprint LTH 291. Comes with 6 PostScript figures and 1 sty-file. We study the nature of gauge fixing ambiguities in two dimensional gauge theories. We find that these ambiguities can be related to the asociated spin model. They can be eliminated by means of a (multigrid) annealing algorithm.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages

entry.title: A streamlined method for chiral fermions on the lattice
entry.summary: We discuss the use of renormalization counterterms to restore the chiral gauge symmetry in a lattice theory of Wilson fermions. We show that a large class of counterterms can be implemented automatically by making a simple modification to the fermion determinant.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, ANL-HEP-CP-92-103

entry.title: A method for putting chiral fermions on the lattice
entry.summary: We describe a method to put chiral gauge theories on the lattice. Our method makes heavy use of the effective action for chiral fermions in the continuum, which is in general complex. As an example we discuss the chiral Schwinger model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, HLRZ 92-81
