entry.summary: We estimate theoretically the cost of the multi-boson method in the non-hermitian approximation. It is shown that it is proportional to $V(\log V)^2/m^4$. For a global update of the scalar fields the cost decreases by a factor $m$ with a $\log V$ overhead.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages LaTex, 3 figures

entry.title: Universality in the Critical Behavior of the Correlation Functions in 2d Simplicial Gravity
entry.summary: The analogue of the loop-loop correlation function in 2d gravity for the planar connected $\phi^3$ diagrams is calculated. It is shown that although the discretized formulas are different the scaling limit is the same as for the loop-loop correlation function. The derivation may serve as an alternative definition of the volume-volume correlator of Euclidean quantum gravity in $2d$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Chiral Anomaly on a Lattice
entry.summary: A calculation of the chiral anomaly on a finite lattice without fermion doubling is presented . The lattice gauge field is defined in the spirit of noncommutative geometry. Standard formulas for the continuum anomaly are obtained as a limit.
entry.arxiv:comment: inputs AMSTEX macros, 13 output pages

entry.title: Field strength correlations in the QCD vacuum at short distance
entry.summary: We determine by numerical simulations on a lattice the gauge--invariant two--point correlation function of the gauge field strengths in the QCD vacuum, down to a distance of 0.1 fm.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTeX file, + 3 PS figures, uuencoded-tar-compressed

entry.title: Gauge--invariant field correlators in QCD at finite temperature
entry.summary: We study by numerical simulations on a lattice the behaviour of the gauge--invariant two--point correlation functions of the gauge field strengths across the deconfinement phase transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX file, + 5 PS figures, uuencoded-tar-compressed

entry.title: Molecular dynamics for full QCD simulations with an improved action
entry.summary: I derive the equation of motion in molecular dynamics for doing full lattice QCD simulations with clover quarks. The even-odd preconditioning technique, expected to significantly reduce the computational effort, is further developed for the simulations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, figures included into the text

entry.title: A Convergence Proof for Linked Cluster Expansions
entry.summary: We prove that for a general $N$-component model on a $d$-dimensional lattice $\bZ^d$ with pairwise nearest-neighbor coupling and general local interaction obeying a stability bound the linked cluster expansion has a finite radius of convergence. The proof uses Mayer Montroll equations for connected Green functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, latex

entry.title: Some aspects of simulation algorithms for dynamical fermions
entry.summary: Three topics concerning fermion simulation algorithms are discussed: 1.) A performance comparison of the multiboson technique to simulate dynamical fermions and the Kramers equation algorithm, 2.) the question of reversibility in the Hybrid Monte Carlo algorithm and 3.) the implementation of Symanzik's improvement program for dynamical Wilson fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk given by K.J. at the workshop ``Accelerating Fermion Algorithms'', J\"ulich, February 21st to 23rd, 1996, 5 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: Hybrid Molecular Dynamics for Lattice Supersymmetry
entry.summary: We present the first results obtained with a Hybrid Molecular Dynamics algorithm applied to an $N=1$ SU(2) Super-Yang--Mills on the lattice. We derive the Hamilton equations of motion for the system with Wilson gluinos and present preliminary results on small lattices.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, uuencoded file containing latex source and two ps figures

entry.title: New fixed point action for SU(3) lattice gauge theory
entry.summary: We present a new fixed point action for SU(3) lattice gauge theory, which has --- compared to earlier published fixed point actions --- shorter interaction range and smaller violations of rotational symmetry in the static $q\bar{q}$-potential even at shortest distances.
entry.arxiv:comment: uuencoded latex file, 15 pages 6 figures using macros cite, epsf, dina4, equations, epic

entry.title: Lattice gauge-fixing for generic covariant gauges
entry.summary: We propose a method which allows the generalization of the Landau lattice gauge-fixing procedure to generic covariant gauges. We report preliminary numerical results showing how the procedure works for $SU(2)$ and $SU(3)$. We also report numerical results showing that the contribution of finite lattice-spacing effects and/or spurious copies are relevant in the lattice gauge-fixing procedure.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, latex, two latex figures included

entry.title: Properties of QCD vacuum from lattice
entry.summary: A disorder parameter is constructed which signals the condensation of vortices. The construction is tested by numerical simulations. Advances in the understanding of the basic properties of QCD vacuum will be reported. Three main subjects will be touched: 1) Condensation of monopoles and confinement. 2) Topology, or instanton physics. 3) Gauge invariant field strength correlators, and their behaviour across the deconfining phase transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 5 postscript figures, typset using sprocl.sty

entry.title: Non-perturbative determination of beta-functions and excited string states from lattices
entry.summary: We use lattice sum rules for the static quark potential to determine the beta-function for symmetric and asymmetric lattices non-perturbatively. We also study the colour field distributions in excited gluonic states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LATEX, 1 postscript figure

entry.title: Glueballs from Improved Lattice Actions
entry.summary: The low-lying glueball masses and the hadronic scale $r_0$ are computed in lattice SU(3) gauge theory with the aim of establishing the effectiveness of the improved action approach in removing finite-spacing artifacts. The use of anisotropic lattices in which the temporal spacing is much smaller than that in the spatial directions allows much more efficient glueball mass measurements.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX using sprocl.sty, 1 postscript figure, contributed paper to PANIC'96, Williamsburg

entry.title: Gauge fixing, zero--momentum modes and the calculation of masses on a lattice
entry.summary: It is shown that the zero--momentum modes can strongly affect the values of the masses, for example the magnetic screening mass $m_m$, calculated from gauge--dependent correlators with zero momentum.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, uuencoded Latex file and one figure (eps-file)

entry.title: Monopole Spectra in non-Abelian Gauge Theories
entry.summary: We study the continuum limit of the length spectrum of magnetic monopole structures found after various Abelian projections of pure gauge SU(2), including the maximally Abelian gauge. We comment on Gribov copies, and measurements of the string tension.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(topology) LaTeX, with 4 LaTeX figures

entry.title: Lattice Background Effective Action: a Proposal
entry.summary: We propose a method based on the Schr\"odinger functional for computing on the lattice the gauge invariant effective action for external background fields. We check this method by studying the U(1) lattice gauge theory in presence of a constant magnetic background field.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(topology)

entry.title: Supersymmetric gauge theories on the lattice
entry.summary: The perspectives of numerical simulations in supersymmetric quantum field theories with vector-like gauge symmetries are discussed. A numerical simulation algorithm for SU(2) gauge theory with gluinos is studied and the first results on the glueball-gluinoball spectrum are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex, 3 pages; Talk presented at LATTICE96(theoretical developments)

entry.title: Two Flavour QCD Phase Transition
entry.summary: Results on the phase transition in QCD with two flavours of light staggered fermions from an ongoing simulation are presented. We find the restoration of the chiral SU(2) x SU(2) symmetry, but not of the axial U_A(1) symmetry.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX2e, amstex package. 4 pages, 2 figures. Talk presented at the 10th International Conference on Problems of Quantum Field Theory, Crimea

entry.title: Recent Developments in Fermion Simulation Algorithms
entry.summary: A summary of recent developments in the field of simulation algorithms for dynamical fermions is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk given at the International Symposium on Lattice Field Theory, 4-8 June 1996, St. Louis, Mo, USA, Latex, 3 Figures, 7 pages

entry.title: Study of Liapunov Exponents and the Reversibility of Molecular Dynamics Algorithms
entry.summary: We study the question of lack of reversibility and the chaotic nature of the equations of motion in numerical simulations of lattice QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex file with 3 pages, 1 figure. Talk presented at Lattice'96 by C. Liu

entry.title: Polyakov Loops and Magnetic Screening from Monopoles in SU(2) Lattice Gauge Theory
entry.summary: We present results from magnetic monopoles in $SU(2)$ lattice gauge theory at finite temperature. The lattices are $16^{3}\times N_{t}$, for $N_{t}=4,6,8,12$, at $\beta=2.5115$. Quantities discussed are: the spacial string tension, Polyakov loops, and the screening of timelike and spacelike magnetic currents.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, four Postscript figures, Latex

entry.title: Classical solutions in lattice gauge theories
entry.summary: The solutions of the classical equations of motion on a periodic lattice are found which correspond to abelian single and double Dirac sheets. These solutions exist also in non--abelian theories. Possible applications of these solutions to the calculation of gauge dependent and gauge invariant observables are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Latex file including four figures

entry.title: A Renormalization Group for Dynamical Triangulations in Arbitrary Dimensions
entry.summary: A block spin renormalization group approach is proposed for the dynamical triangulation formulation of quantum gravity in arbitrary dimensions. Renormalization group flow diagrams are presented for the three-dimensional and four-dimensional theories near their respective transitions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 6 postscript figures, revtex

entry.title: Redesigning Lattice QCD
entry.summary: There has been major progress in recent years in the development of improved discretizations of the QCD action, current operators, etc for use in numerical simulations that employ very coarse lattices. These lectures review the field theoretic techniques used to design these discretizations, techniques for testing and tuning the new formalisms that result, and recent simulation results employing these formalisms.
entry.arxiv:comment: Schladming Winter School lectures (to be published in the Proceedings); 56 pages, LaTeX

entry.title: Overlap for Majorana-Weyl fermions
entry.summary: The power of the overlap formalism is illustrated by regularizing theories based on Majorana-Weyl fermions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, uufile contains the tex file and espcrc2.sty file, Talk presented in Lattice 96 at St. Louis (Chiral Gauge Theories)

entry.title: Fixed point action and topological charge for SU(2) gauge theory
entry.summary: We present a theoretically consistent definition of the topological charge operator based on renormalization group arguments. Results of the measurement of the topological susceptibility at zero and finite temperature for SU(2) gauge theory are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX file. Talk presented at LATTICE96(improvement)

entry.title: Scaling functions for O(4) in three dimensions
entry.summary: Monte Carlo simulation using a cluster algorithm is used to compute the scaling part of the free energy for a three dimensional O(4) spin model. The results are relevant for analysis of lattice studies of high temperature QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 6 figures, uses epsf.sty

entry.title: Species doubling and effective Lagrangians
entry.summary: Coupling gauge fields to the chiral currents from an effective Lagrangian for pseudoscalar mesons naturally gives rise to a species doubling phenomenon similar to that seen with fermionic fields in lattice gauge theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, uses espcrc.sty. Talk presented at LATTICE96(poster)

entry.title: A lattice formulation of chiral gauge theories
entry.summary: We present a method for implementing gauge theories of chiral fermions on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages LaTeX, espcrc2 style file. Talk presented at LATTICE96(chiral gauge)

entry.title: Condensation of vortices in the X-Y model in 3d: a disorder parameter
entry.summary: A disorder parameter is constructed which signals the condensation of vortices. The construction is tested by numerical simulations on lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, postscript file Talk presented at LATTICE96(topology)

entry.title: Correlations in fluctuating geometries
entry.summary: We compare two definitions of connected correlation functions in fluctuating geometries. We show results of the MC simulations for 4D dynamical triangulation in the elongated phase and compare them with the exact calculations of correlation functions in the branched polymer model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex + espcrc2.tex (supplied) 3 figures included as eps files. Talk presented at LATTICE96(gravity)

entry.title: Quenched Light Hadron Spectrum and Decay Constants using Improved Wilson Fermion Actions
entry.summary: We compare results obtained using the Sheikholeslami-Wohlert (SW) fermion action with tree-level and tadpole-improved coefficients for $5.7\le\beta\le 6.2$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(spectrum), 3 LaTeX pages plus 5 ps figures, espcrc2.sty (included)

entry.title: Lattice computation of structure functions
entry.summary: Recent lattice calculations of hadron structure functions are described.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk presented at LATTICE96, LaTeX, 7 pages, 5 figures, espcrc2.sty and epsfig.sty included

entry.title: Abelian dominance and adjoint color sources
entry.summary: Abelian dominance in the case of color sources in the fundamental representation is shown to follow from certain properties of maximal abelian projected SU(2) gauge theory. The possibility of having an analog of abelian dominance in the case of adjoint representation sources is addressed in the same framework.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 figures. Requires espcrc2.sty and epsfig.sty. Talk presented at LATTICE96(topology)

entry.title: Fixed-point action for fermions in QCD
entry.summary: We report our progress constructing a fixed-point action for fermions interacting with SU(3) gauge fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX file. Talk presented at LATTICE96(improvement)

entry.title: Scalar Quarkonium and the Scalar Glueball
entry.summary: Valence approximation glueball mass and decay calculations support the identification of $f_J(1710)$ as the lightest scalar glueball. An alternate glueball candidate is $f_0(1500)$. I present evidence for the identification of $f_0(1500)$ as $s\overline{s}$ quarkonium.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages of Latex, 2 PostScript figures, uses espcrc2.sty which is included, Talk presented at LATTICE96(spectrum)

entry.title: Blocking of Dynamical Triangulations with Matter
entry.summary: We use the recently proposed node decimation algorithm for blocking dynamical geometries to investigate a class of models, with central charge greater than unity, coupled to 2D gravity. We demonstrate that the blocking preserves the fractal structure of the surfaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(gravity), 3 pages, LaTeX, espcrc2.sty

entry.title: Remarks on the quantum gravity interpretation of 4D dynamical triangulation
entry.summary: We review some of the phenomenology in 4D dynamical triangulation and explore its interpretation in terms of a euclidean effective action of the continuum form $\intx \sqrt{g} [\mu -\frac{1}{16\pi G} R + \cdots]$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(gravity); 3 pages; LaTeX, espcrc2.sty

entry.title: Fast Fermion Monte Carlo
entry.summary: Three possibilities to speed up the Hybrid Monte Carlo algorithm are investigated. Changing the step-size adaptively brings no practical gain. On the other hand, substantial improvements result from using an approximate Hamiltonian or a preconditioned action.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(algorithms), 3 pages

entry.title: Improved lattice actions
entry.summary: The main strategies to reduce lattice artifacts for spin models, gauge fields, free fermions and QCD are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(improvement) 13 pages, Latex, 8 figures included (espcrc2.sty is not included now, and some spelling errors are corrected.)

entry.title: Progress report on hadron spectroscopy with improved actions
entry.summary: Quenched light hadron masses are measured on blocked lattices, using 6 different lattice discretizations of the Dirac operator. Results are compared with those of unblocked lattices, allowing for a ``ranking'' of the Dirac discretizations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, latex, 4 postscript figures, poster presented at LATTICE96(improvement)

entry.title: Lattice Chiral Gauge Theories in a Renormalizable Gauge
entry.summary: The lattice formulation of gauge theories in a renormalizable gauge is discussed. The formulation invokes a new phase diagram, and it may allow for a lattice definition of Chiral Gauge Theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, uses espcrc2.sty, 4 pages

entry.title: Pomerons and Lattices: a Progress Report
entry.summary: We report on some attempts to use lattice QCD to investigate topics in strong interactions phenomenology which are usually interpreted in terms of soft Pomeron exchange.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LAT96, 3 pages, Latex, one style file and 2 PostScript pictures included

entry.title: Binding Energies in Nonrelativistic Field Theories
entry.summary: Relativistic corrections communicate the binding energy of a bound state to its kinetic mass. This mechanism is reviewed and used to explain anomalous results of Collins, Edwards, Heller, and Sloan (hep-lat/9512026), which compared rest and kinetic masses of heavy-light mesons and quarkonia.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 1 figure, poster presented at LATTICE96(heavy quarks)

entry.title: Dynamical Fermion on Random-Block Lattice
entry.summary: Massless fermion field interacting with abelian dynamical gauge field on 2-dimensional random-block lattices are investigated using Hybrid Monte Carlo simulations. Preliminary results of the Wilson loop and the chiral correlation function are in agreement with the continuum Schwinger model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, Latex, 2 Postscript figures, uses espcrc2.sty, Presented at LATTICE96(poster)

entry.title: On the Nf and a Dependence of BK
entry.summary: We present results of a study of BK using tadpole improved gauge invariant staggered operators. Using three ensembles of 16^3x32 configurations with varying numbers of dynamical flavors, we observe a small dependence on Nf. Using seven quenched ensembles between beta=5.7 and beta=6.2 we extrapolate to a=0.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(phenomenology)

entry.title: The Staggered Eta-prime with Smeared Operators
entry.summary: We present a refined calculation of the eta-prime mass using staggered fermions and Wuppertal smeared operators. We use quenched and dynamical configurations of size 16^3x32 with Nf=0, Nf=2 and Nf=4, and compare our results with the expected forms from quenched, partially quenched and unquenched chiral perturbation thoery.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(chirality in qcd)

entry.title: Exact Local Bosonic Algorithm for Dynamical Quarks
entry.summary: We present an exact local bosonic algorithm for the simulation of dynamical fermions in lattice QCD. We show that this algorithm is a viable alternative to the Hybrid Monte Carlo algorithm.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 1 PostScript figure; Talk presented at LATTICE96(algorithms)

entry.title: Recent Results on the Abelian Projection of Lattice Gluodynamics
entry.summary: The abelian projection of lattice gluodynamics is reviewed. The main topics are: abelian and monopole dominance, monopole condensate as the disorder parameter, effective abelian Lagrangian, monopoles in the instanton field, Aharonov -- Bohm effect on the lattice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, LaTeX, 7 PS figures, Talk presented at LATTICE96

entry.title: Reply to A. Patrascioiu's and E. Seiler's comment on our paper "The two-phase issue in the O(n) non-linear sigma-model: a Monte Carlo study"
entry.summary: We reply to a comment by A. Patrascioiu and E. Seiler appeared in hep-lat/9608138 on our paper hep-lat/9608002.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, latex file, no figures. Corrected english mistakes and improved the exposition of point 1

entry.title: Thermodynamics of 1-flavor QCD
entry.summary: We present first results, for heavy to moderate quark masses, of a study of thermodynamic properties of 1-flavor QCD, using the multiboson algorithm.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 PostScript figures; Talk presented at LATTICE96(finite temperature)

entry.title: Heavy Light Weak Matrix Elements
entry.summary: I review the status of lattice calculations of heavy-light weak matrix elements, concentrating on semileptonic B decays to light mesons, B -> K* gamma, the B meson decay constant, f_B, and the mixing parameter B_B.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, LaTeX2e with 6 postscript figures. Uses espcrc2.sty and epsf.sty (included). Talk presented at LATTICE96(heavy quarks)

entry.title: Hubbard Model and Luscher fermions
entry.summary: We discuss numerical complexity of the L\"uscher algorithm applied to the Hubbard Model. In particular we present comparison to a certain algorithm based on direct computation of the fermionic determinant.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, espcrc2.sty, latex, 2 figures. Talk presented at LATTICE96(algorithms). Revised version. Some spelling errors has been corrected

entry.title: Self-organized criticality
entry.summary: I review the concept of self-organized criticality, wherein dissipative systems naturally drive themselves to a critical state with important phenomena occurring over a wide range of length and time scales. Several exact results are demonstrated for the Abelian sandpile.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 5 color figures; uses sprocl.sty; contribution to the "Int. conf. on multi-scale phenomena and their simulation," 30/Sept-4/Oct/96, Bielefeld, Germany

entry.title: Better Actions
entry.summary: We explain why compact U(1) confines and how to fix it. We show that plaquettes of negative trace carry most of the confinement signal in compact SU(2). We show how to perform noncompact gauge-invariant simulations without auxiliary fields. We suggest a way to simulate fermions without doublers.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(algorithms), 4 pages, Latex, espcrc2, pictex

entry.title: Topology in 4D simplicial quantum gravity
entry.summary: We simulate 4d simplicial gravity for three topologis S4, S3xS1, (S1)^4 and show that the free energy for these three fixed topology ensembles is the same in the thermodynamic limit. We show, that the next-to-leading order corrections, at least away from the critical point, can be described by kinematic sources.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: Gluinos on the lattice: quenched calculations
entry.summary: As a preparation for the numerical study of the SU(2) gauge theory with gluinos, the spectral properties of the fermion matrix and the masses of pseudoscalar and scalar states are investigated in the quenched approximation. The behaviour of the disconnected fermion diagrams on small lattices is also studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: latex2e, 12 pages, 5 figures with epsfig

entry.title: Improvements of the local bosonic algorithm
entry.summary: We report on several improvements of the local bosonic algorithm proposed by M. Luescher. We find that preconditioning and over-relaxation works very well. A detailed comparison between the bosonic and the Kramers-algorithms shows comparable performance for the physical situation examined.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at LATTICE96(algorithms), 3 pages, Latex, espcrc2

entry.title: Computation of the one-loop Symanzik coefficients for the square action
entry.summary: We compute the one-loop coefficients for an alternative Symanzik improved pure gauge SU{N} lattice action (N=2 and N=3). For the standard Symanzik improved action we confirm previous results by L\"{u}scher and Weisz.
entry.arxiv:comment: 45 pages, LaTeX, includes library.ps for generating Feynman diagrams

entry.title: SU(N) gauge theories for all N
entry.summary: We show that SU(N) gauge theories in 2+1 dimensions are close to N=\infty for N \geq 2. The dimensionful coupling, g^2, is proportional to 1/N, at large N, confirming the usual diagram-based expectation. Preliminary calculations in 3+1 dimensions indicate that the same is true there.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX.

entry.title: Faster Fermions in the Tempered Hybrid Monte Carlo Algorithm
entry.summary: Tempering is used to change the quark mass while remaining in equilibrium between the trajectories of a standard hybrid Monte Carlo simulation of four flavours of staggered fermions. The algorithm is faster for small enough quark masses, and particularly so when more than one mass is required.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at the conference Multi-Scale Phenomena and their Simulation from 30.9.-4.10 1996 in Bielefeld

entry.title: A toy model test of a new algorithm for bozonization of fermion determinants
entry.summary: Different aspects of bozonization algorithm proposed by Slavnov are tested by numerical simulations of a one dimensional toy model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex, 5 postscript figures

entry.title: Fermionic Monte Carlo algorithms for lattice QCD
entry.summary: The increase with time of computer resources devoted to simulations of full QCD is spectacular. Yet the reduction of systematic errors is comparatively slow. This is due to the algorithmic complexity of the problem. I review, in elementary terms, the origin of this complexity, and estimate it for 3 exact fermion algorithms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, latex, uses sprocl.sty; contribution to the "Int. conf. on multi-scale phenomena and their simulation," 30/Sept-4/Oct/96, Bielefeld, Germany

entry.title: A Polynomial Hybrid Monte Carlo Algorithm
entry.summary: We present a simulation algorithm for dynamical fermions that combines the multiboson technique with the Hybrid Monte Carlo algorithm. We find that the algorithm gives a substantial gain over the standard methods in practical simulations. We point out the ability of the algorithm to treat fermion zeromodes in a clean and controllable manner.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 1 figure, 12 pages
